org.mundo.rt
Class AsyncCall

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.AsyncCall

public class AsyncCall
extends java.lang.Object

AsyncCall objects are returned by stub methods that perform asynchronous remote method calls. The client uses such objects to wait for completion of the RMC and to obtain the result.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler
See Also:
DoObject

Nested Class Summary
static interface AsyncCall.IResultListener
          Implement this interface to listen for the result of a asynchronous method call.

Constructor Detail

AsyncCall

public AsyncCall(DoObject cs,
                 java.lang.String interfaceName,
                 java.lang.String methodName,
                 TypedMap req)
Creates a new AsyncCall object. This constructor is usually only called from automatically-generated stub code.

Parameters:
cs - the client stub creating the call object.
interfaceName - globally-unique name of interface that the remote object implements.
methodName - the name of the method to call.
req - a map holding the parameter values and options that will be passed to the server stub.
Method Detail

getId

public GUID getId()
Returns the GUID of the call. Each call is assigned an unique ID.

Returns:
the unique ID of this call.

invoke

public void invoke()
Invokes the remote method. Builds the request message and sends it to the server stub on the other side. invoke returns immediately after the request message has been sent.

invokeOneWay

public void invokeOneWay()
Invokes the remote method as one-way call. Thus, the server stub will not return any reply message to this request.

setExpectedReplies

public void setExpectedReplies(int n)
This sets the number of expected replies for this RMC call.

Parameters:
n - number of replies to wait for until the call is removed from the session. The value -1 is special and the call will not automatically removed from the session.

waitForReply

public boolean waitForReply()
Wait for the replies. This method waits until the remote method call has received at least one reply

Returns:
true on success; or false if an exception has occurred on the server side.
Throws:
RMCException - in case of a timeout.

waitForReply

public boolean waitForReply(int n)
Wait for the replies. This method waits until the remote method call has received a number of replies.

Parameters:
n - number of replies to wait for.
Returns:
true on success; or false if an exception has occurred on the server side.
Throws:
RMCException - in case of a timeout.

getException

public java.lang.Exception getException()
Returns the exception pending.

Returns:
the exception object describing the problem that has occured; or null if no exception is pending.

getObj

public java.lang.Object getObj()
Returns the return value of the RMC. The method implicitly blocks until the RMC has completed.

Returns:
the return value of the remote method call.

getReturnValueAsMap

public TypedMap getReturnValueAsMap()
Returns the return value of the RMC as passive map. The method implicitly blocks until the RMC has completed.

Returns:
the return value of the remote method call.

getMap

public TypedMap getMap()
Returns the whole reply message. Beside the return value, the reply message may contain additional information from the server stub. The method implicitly blocks until the RMC has completed.

Returns:
the reply message containing the return value and additional stub-dependent information.

getAllResults

public java.util.List getAllResults()
Returns all reply messages received so far. May return an empty list if no messages have been received.

Returns:
the list of reply messages containing the return value and additional stub-dependent information.

getNumberOfResults

public int getNumberOfResults()
Returns the number of replies that have been received

Returns:
the number of reply messages that have been received

setResultListener

public void setResultListener(AsyncCall.IResultListener l)
Sets the result listener for an asynchronous call. To avoid race conditions, asynchronous method calls with listeners should be performed like this: 
 AsyncCall callObj = stub.someMethod(stub.CREATEONLY);
 callObj.setResultListener(listener);
 callObj.invoke();

Parameters:
l - the result listener.

setIgnoreClientErrors

public void setIgnoreClientErrors(boolean b)
Sets whether errors during processing of the reply message should lead to exceptions or not. This option is useful when calling remote methods via reflection and objects in the reply message may be unknown.

setOptions

public void setOptions(DoObject.Options opt)
Sets options for the call.
